text.__SUMMARY__: Ivara terryi is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Pyramidellidae, the pyrams and their allies.
text.Description: The length of the shell attains 3.2 mm.
text.Distribution:
This marine species occurs in the following locations:
Caribbean Sea
Colombia
Gulf of Mexico
Mexico
Panama
text.References: Rosenberg, G., F. Moretzsohn, and E. F. García. 2009. Gastropoda (Mollusca) of the Gulf of Mexico, Pp. 579–699 in Felder, D.L. and D.K. Camp (eds.), Gulf of Mexico–Origins, Waters, and Biota. Biodiversity. Texas A&M Press, College Station, Texas.
text.External links: To World Register of Marine Species
